Posted By: infernox10 (4/29/2011 2:21:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of my favorite cards ever printed. I love everything about this, especially the incredible artwork that manages to be both elegantly beautiful and disturbingly creepy. I was lucky enough to open one and she has massacred many a swarm ever since.  
  
Tournament value? I haven't seen any yet, but who knows what innistrad may bring. It is obviously a graveyard-related block, so reanimating her quickly might be something we experience often come september 2011.  
  
One final note: does anyone look at this card and see foreshadowing of a war between phyrexia and the eldrazi? From the ability to the flavor text, i think i have gained future sight.
posts.html:
One of my favorite cards ever printed. I love everything about this, especially the incredible artwork that manages to be both elegantly beautiful and disturbingly creepy. I was lucky enough to open one and she has massacred many a swarm ever since.

Tournament value? I haven't seen any yet, but who knows what innistrad may bring. It is obviously a graveyard-related block, so reanimating her quickly might be something we experience often come september 2011.

One final note: does anyone look at this card and see foreshadowing of a war between phyrexia and the eldrazi? From the ability to the flavor text, i think i have gained future sight.

Posted By: tworainclouds (7/31/2011 12:20:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
That is not a hat.  
  
That is her face.  
  
**THAT IS HER FACE.**  
  
... that's scary. See also [Marrow Shards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marrow Shards).  
  
...I like how some of the Praetors were given a sort of arbitrary ability that happens to match their color nicely. Elesh : Vigilance. Jin-Gitaxias : Flash. Etc.  
  
It's also fun seeing everyone who cracks one of the Praetors go look up "praetor" and "cenobite" and "augur" and such in the dictionary. Praetor is an awesome creature type. And the titles given to each Praetor actually fit their color identity remarkably well. Congrats to WOTC for really nailing the New Phyrexia flavor :)
posts.html:
That is not a hat.

That is her face.

THAT IS HER FACE.

... that's scary. See also Marrow Shards.

...I like how some of the Praetors were given a sort of arbitrary ability that happens to match their color nicely. Elesh : Vigilance. Jin-Gitaxias : Flash. Etc.

It's also fun seeing everyone who cracks one of the Praetors go look up "praetor" and "cenobite" and "augur" and such in the dictionary. Praetor is an awesome creature type. And the titles given to each Praetor actually fit their color identity remarkably well. Congrats to WOTC for really nailing the New Phyrexia flavor :)

posts.post_content: In addition to using godhead of awe with Elesh Norn, you can also use dovescape to prevent non-creature spells to be casted. this nearly makes a complete lockdown as only creature effects that activate when they "enter the battlefield" or "sent to the graveyard" can be used to destroy any of those 3 cards when they are all in play. Talk about board control!

posts.post_content:
Miss Norn is simply beautiful, Her art is Queenly and her red Drapings make it a picture you can just stare at up close, plus is snowing (or something.......) My favorite art in set/block.
  
   
As far as the card goes....just read it....as stated earlier your Grizzley Bears can now kill your opponents Titans. This is the epitome of 5/5 for me: Legendary, Beautiful, Flavorful, Balanced (by late game CMC and being legendary in this case) and Lethal as Sin.

posts.post_content:
This gal is going to be the center-piece of my ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) control/burn deck. White phyrexia is overflowing with flavor,.. cards like [Forced Worship](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forced Worship), [Marrow Shards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marrow Shards), [Due Respect](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Due Respect) and Elesh Norn herself are great examples. Her flavor is simply BOW DOWN, and I love it.  
  
Just ordered two of these in foil... can't wait to see how beautiful they are up close. 5/5

Posted By: MrDelicious84 (5/14/2011 7:13:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.  
  
Elesh Norn - [Norn's Annex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norn's Annex)  
Jin-Gitaxias - [Gitaxian Probe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gitaxian Probe)  
Sheoldred - [Reaper of Sheoldred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reaper of Sheoldred)  
Urabrask - [Priest of Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Urabrask)  
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually **shows** Vorinclex in its art?  
  
That's right. [Praetors' Counsel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Praetors' Counsel).
posts.html:
I just realized each of the Praetors seems to have a "signature spell", a la the M11 planeswalkers.

Elesh Norn - Norn's Annex
Jin-Gitaxias - Gitaxian Probe
Sheoldred - Reaper of Sheoldred
Urabrask - Priest of Urabrask
Vorinclex - this is the iffy one. Unlike the other four, nothing else in the block has his name in it ... but guess which green sorcery showed up in Mirrodin Beseiged that actually shows Vorinclex in its art?

That's right. Praetors' Counsel.
